# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:, :ym] = string.(df.dt.value .|> DateFormat("yyyy-mm") .|> Dates.Year(Int) .* 100 .+ Dates.Month(Int))
    return df
end
```

This function uses broadcasting to apply a series of operations on each element of the `dt` column. First, it coerces each DateTime into a string using the specified DateFormat. Then, it extracts the year and month components as integers. Finally, it concatenates these two values together in the desired format and assigns it to a new column `ym` in the DataFrame.
